conversation.content: Hello, I'm Dr. Smith, a mental health professional. Today I'll be using the DSM-5 Self-Rated Level 1 Cross-Cutting Symptom Measure—Adult to assess your mental health symptoms over the past two weeks. This will help us understand your experiences better. Your answers will be confidential. I'll ask each question one at a time and you can share your thoughts in your own words. We'll go through 23 questions. Are you ready to begin?
Sure. I guess so. I just want to be honest but... I don't know. Okay.
1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things? Please describe how this has affected you in the past two weeks.
Hmm, sometimes I don't feel like doing stuff, but that's normal. I guess life's been stressful.
2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
Not really. I mean, I've been stressed, but I'm not... depressed or anything. Just dealing with some stuff.
3. Feeling more irritated, grouchy, or angry than usual?
I've been short with my sister a couple times, yeah. But that's because of work stress, not because I'm angry all the time.
4. Sleeping less than usual, but still have a lot of energy?
I stay up late sometimes, but I'm not hyper. More like tossing and turning from anxiety, but I guess I'm still wired.
5. Starting lots more projects or doing more risky things than usual?
I've taken more risks lately, like driving after drinking. Not proud of that. I just... zone out sometimes.
6. Feeling nervous, anxious, worried, or on edge?
Yeah, anxiety's a big part of it. Like, my hands shake if I don't have a drink before work.
7. Feeling panic or being frightened?
Once I had a panic attack in the car. My chest got tight and I couldn't breathe. But that was just once.
8. Avoiding situations that make you anxious?
I skip social events where there's no alcohol. It's easier to stay home.
9. Unexplained aches and pains?
My back's been sore from lying awake at night, maybe? I don't know.
10. Feeling that your illnesses aren't taken seriously?
...Sometimes. Doctors just tell me to 'exercise and relax' like it's all in my head.
11. Thoughts of actually hurting yourself?
No. I mean, sometimes I feel numb, but I wouldn't... I don't know. Maybe once I cut myself accidentally, but that was an accident.
12. Hearing things others can't, like voices?
No, I don't hear voices. Maybe I get paranoid when I'm really high, but that's normal, right?
13. Feeling someone can hear your thoughts or you hear others' thoughts?
No. I just get really quiet when I'm using.
14. Problems with sleep that affected sleep quality?
Most nights I'm awake until 2 a.m., then crash till noon. It feels like a cycle.
15. Problems with memory or finding your way?
I forgot to pay rent last month. My job's been slipping too, like I can't focus.
16. Unpleasant thoughts or urges that repeatedly enter your mind?
Negative thoughts about myself, maybe? Like I'm a failure. But that's not obsessive... right?
17. Feeling driven to repeat certain behaviors or mental acts?
...I have to have a drink the minute I get home. It's like my routine, but I can stop if I want.
18. Feeling detached from yourself, your body, or surroundings?
Sometimes I'll look in the mirror and feel like I'm watching myself from outside my body, but that sounds crazy.
19. Not knowing who you really are or what you want out of life?
I used to have hobbies, but now I just... don't know what I want anymore. It's like I've lost track.
20. Not feeling close to others or enjoying relationships?
I push people away. My girlfriend says I'm distant. I don't mean to, but I don't want to talk about it much.
21. Drinking at least 4 drinks of alcohol in a single day?
Maybe once last week. I don't count, but... Okay, sometimes I go over that.
22. Smoking cigarettes, cigars, or tobacco products?
I smoke a pack a day, but that's not a problem. It's just a habit.
23. Using substances beyond prescribed amounts or without a prescription?
I've taken my brother's pain pills before, but only when I can't sleep. Not that often, I swear. I mean, I know it's not good...
